 Binary Exercise problems:
1.a: 1 = 1
1.b: 42 = 101010
1.c: 256 = 100000000
1.d: 4,294,967,296 = 11111111111111111111111111111111 (32 1s)

2.a: 10000000 = 128
2.b: 10101010 = 170
2.c: 11110000 = 240
2.d: 11001100 = 204

3.a: 111 + 111 = 1110
3.b: 1010 + 1010 = 10100
3.c: 11101 + 1010 = 100111
3.d: 1101 - 11 = 1010
3.e: 10001 - 100 = 1101
3.f: 101 x 10 = 1010
3.g: 1011 x 11 = 100001
3.h: 1101 / 11 = This might not actually work? 1101 is 13 and 11 is 3, and 13/3 is not a whole number, it's 4.333 repeating.

5.a: (?)10000000 -> TC -> (?)10000000 = (?)128
5.b: 10101010 -> TC -> 01010111 = 87
5.c: 11110000 -> TC -> 00010000 = 16
5.d: 11001100 -> TC -> 00110100 = 52
5.e: -16 = 11110000 -> TC -> 00010000
5.f: 128 = (+)10000000 -> TC -> (-)10000000
5.g: -128 = (-)10000000 -> TC -> (+)10000000
5.h: -123 = 10000101 -> TC -> 01111011

6.a: 11111 | 11111 = 11111
6.b: 11111 ^ 11111 = 00000
6.c: 10101 & 11111 = 10101
6.d: 10101 | 11111 = 11111
6.e: 00000 ^ 11111 = 11111
6.f: 1 << 3 = 1000
6.g: 100 >> 2 = 1
6.h: ~10101 = 01010
6.i: 100 << 1 = 1000
6.j: 1010 >> 1 = 0101
6.k: ~11111 = 00000
